TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The Back on Track Edition

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_mzf0vcRuhn1rr2wit.jpg"/><strong>Felipe (HarvesteR)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Big steps in the design of the contracts system as a whole. Contracts isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t a single one-liner feature, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a full set of gameplay mechanics, new content, code, and not least here, writing. I wasnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t quite sure where to start with all that, so I took some time to start writing it down into a detailed spec, and many ideas started to take shape. We now have a much clearer picture of what needs to get done for Contracts. Today weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re starting the not very glamourous but very necessary phase of breaking down our ideas into chunks of work that we can manage, and assigning them to everyone. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re also breaking into a new team management software that will hopefully be a good help to keep track of things without too much stress. Not the most interesting of weeks development-wise, admittedly, but there are big things coming up and itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s good that we were able to take the time we needed to prepare for it.</span></p>

<p><strong>Chad (C7)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Glad to be back to work after the vacation. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been working on a few things as development of 0.24 ramps up. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve also been experimenting with Unity 4.3.3, to see if we can upgrade without any issues.</span></p>

<p><span><strong><span id="docs-internal-guid-15456331-933a-1cc4-2864-2d994cac2562">Jim (Romfarer)</span></strong><span><strong>:</strong> This week i have had my computer science hat on and implemented graph algorithms to solve the Ã¢â‚¬Å“minimum cost maximum flowÃ¢â‚¬Â optimization problem.</span></span></p>

<p><strong>Daniel (danRosas)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been planning out the pipeline for this year’s animated shorts, in order to improve production schedules. Everything from a technical point of view, from the storytelling side some ideas are coming up - nothing fancy yet. Also I did some graphics for Miguel and Bob, last week. And IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been struggling with a Creeper coffee mug, trying not to spill it all over myself while working (itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a cube).</span></p>

<p id="docs-internal-guid-15456331-935a-abcb-0142-d9d76aadf18c"><strong>Jesus (Chuchito): </strong><span>IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m new in the dev team, so I have been taking a look at the code.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Alex (aLeXmOrA):</strong>*</span><span>Cleaning databases, making backups, solving some Store minor issues and bugging Facebook support to get our <em>KSP</em> FB page back (itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s fine to know itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s up again).</span></p>

<p><strong>Marco (Samsonart): </strong><span>Testing a few things and playing around with Unity 4.3 . IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve also been identifying common issues that came up during the holiday season to see if the Store can be made even more user friendly.</span></p>

<p><strong>Ted (Ted): </strong><span>Over the past week I’ve been going over the QA and Experimental Teams and seeing what can be improved. So far, I’ve identified that documentation and the organisation of the documentation can be vastly improved and thus have gotten to work on planning and developing it. In addition I’ve been looking over the bug tracker and its forum, doing much the same thing - but to a lesser extent.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Miguel (Maxmaps):</strong> </span><span>Reworking the structure through which the communications theme operates. Hoping to bring you more content and information in a clean, transparent and efficient manner. Also reviving our facebook after a system error on FBÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s part (shoutout to Calisker for that solution) and organizing a pretty awesome supply drop that found its way to Squad HQ.</span></p>

<p><strong>Bob (Calisker): </strong><span>Wondering if anybody has a good costume/mascot company out there. I think itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s time for a life-size Kerbal costume. Let me know if somebody knows a guy. Also, calling danRosas my hero for his design skills. </span></p>

<p><span><strong>Anthony (Rowsdower):</strong> Getting back into the swing of things, I’ve been making my daily community rounds and monitoring the forums, alongside our ace mod team. Additionally, I’ve been helping with the reorganization of some internal workflow, planning some cool social media projects, discussing potential promotional opportunities and taking my time to write proposals on tightening up forum rules & regulations, as well as team practices.<br/></span></p>

<p><span><strong><span id="docs-internal-guid-15456331-9345-59e0-7e59-2b26f17811f5">Lalo: </span></strong><span>Hello my name is Lalo and I’m new on the Kerbal Team. I’m PM and I’m very excited to be part of it</span></span><br/><span></span><br/><span></span></p>
Regarding something Harv mentioned above: do you guys use an Agile software development process?
Welcome Jesus (pronounced Hay-Zeus, right?) and Lalo to the dev team! Can't wait to see what you guys end up doing to KSP!
Lots of writing this week. That's nice.

So what is Lalo's job again? I don't get what a PM is.

Also, KSP Version 0.24: Jesus InsideÃ¢â€žÂ¢

So, theme for Update 0.24: Contracts

I also wander, what PM is....

Found Jesus, but...Lalo???

https://www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/about.php

Planned Features:

  • A Tycoon-Style Career Mode.
  • Take on Contracts to attract interest in your Space Program.
  • Hire astronauts, train them, and make them into heroes.
  • And a whole lot more!

From the About page.

Edited January 15, 2014 by Sirine

Finally, my devnote deprivation is over

No word from Mu? I hope he's still on the team?

OK, let's talk about contracts

- Will they be randomly generated? Or it will be done in the form of campaign of sorts?

- Will we have a choice? For example in the form of three missions ranging from easy to hard - so one can pick a contract easiest, most challenging or most profitable per personal preferences?

- Will game track player's progress? I guess it would suck to get a Moho manned landing contract early in career.

Maybe PM stands for Personal Masseuse?

Finally, my devnote deprivation is over

No word from Mu? I hope he's still on the team?

He's still on the list of developers
I'm hoping they take some time to add more biomes to the other planets and moons in the system. This for me is something that has made the game and career mode in particular interesting to play.

Maybe PM stands for Personal Masseuse?

Well if that's the case then contracts feels like the wrong choice of word. Missions would be a lot better, after all, you get them in mission control.
Jesus we have Jesus here!

Edited January 15, 2014 by KasperVld

Lalo is the new project manager.

I was hoping for prime minister. I mean, it sure sounds like an important job title.

Well if that's the case then contracts feels like the wrong choice of word. Missions would be a lot better, after all, you get them in mission control.
You sure did hear contract. Don't know about 0.24, but contracts and budgets are on the horizon.

http://www.pcgamer.com/uk/2013/12/27/kerbal-space-program-devs-hope-to-add-budgets-reputation-in-2014/

Reading the description of contracts from the link, I think missions are more binding "Now you will go to the Mun and do something with a rover and return", whereas contracts are "Hey, if you happen to land on the Mun I'll pay you", and other one "Do something with a rover", and "Bring some Kerbels back". Maybe you can piece together a "mission" by accepting a number of different "contracts". If that's true, it sounds like a clever hybrid between goals/"story line" and the self-direction we're all used to.

http://www.pcgamer.com/uk/2013/12/27/kerbal-space-program-devs-hope-to-add-budgets-reputation-in-2014/

Hey Rowsdower, can you put links like this in the Announcements forum when they happen? I don't want to have to rely on other users randomly bringing this sort of thing to the forum or trying to find links in (somewhat) unrelated threads. I get that this interview appeared over the holiday but it would be nice in the future. Thanks.

Hah! Fantastic, I thought Articles was dead after the move to a split Weekly.

Hey, regex.

I've decided to post the more notable links up solely as articles for now. Because of their placement on the forum's front page, we believe that they'll get more eyes that way. So far it seems to have gone in the intended direction, but there's always room to try other things. Maybe next time one goes out, I'll post in both areas and measure the effect.

Thanks!
